column4: ok so far unsuccessful, can anybody please help me? i can't ssh tunnel my server at work, i can ping it but everything i try in ssh times out, ssh server is confirmed running on the machine (ssh localhost produces no errors) and the router is set to forward
how are you tunneling?
tried just ssh user@ip
please excuse my poor use of terminology then
correct, just sits there and times out
no worries...just want to make sure I understand so I can hopefully provide some assistance
using the root account on that system
could be another confusion of terms, im using the only account created with ubuntu
it isn't actually root i don't think, like when you set up ubuntu and it gives you the opportunity to create a user, that one
i told him to use sudo /etc/init.d/ssh start to start ssh
no ssh server is absolutely installed im positive of that
not denied per se, it just sits there
i believe he's at the box
if it isn't a default package then nope
i don't know how to do either of those things, ill send him instructions if you tell me how
have him run this command "tail -n 100 /var/log/auth.log | grep sshd"
k sec, gotta text it
i have no earthly idea
i know that the server gets internet access
it is a little tedious troubleshooting remotely like that.  Just have him email you that logfile then and you can parse it yourself
i wish i could continue, but thanks for your help and thank you too dariuskane , hope to see you in here tomorrow ;) im out
your welcome...good luck
